snippet: Bricks unleashed by the storm plunged through the roof of the Argosy Book Store in Manhattan, allowing rainwater to soak historic documents, including acts of Congress signed by Thomas Jefferson.
abstract: Bricks unleashed by the storm plunged through the roof of the Argosy Book Store in Manhattan, allowing rainwater to soak historic documents, including acts of Congress signed by Thomas Jefferson.

headline.main: Storm's Damage Extends to Nation's History
headline.print_headline: Pieces of History Suffer In Wind and Rain’s Wake
